meanings.definition: To move a finger or hand in a quick, smooth motion across a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was swiping the screen to see more pictures.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy swiping through pages of a book.
meanings.sent3: The cat was swiping at the dangling string playfully.
meanings.sent4: The wind was swiping the leaves off the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: He was swiping the table clean with a cloth.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly and often secretly.
meanings.sent1: The thief was caught swiping jewelry from the store.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of swiping money from her friend's purse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was swiping snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The magician was swiping cards from the deck with skill.
meanings.sent5: He was swiping cookies from the jar when no one was looking.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a sweeping motion.
meanings.sent1: He was swiping the tennis ball with great force.
meanings.sent2: The branches were swiping against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The chef was swiping the knife through the vegetables swiftly.
meanings.sent4: The waves were swiping against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: She was swiping the paintbrush across the canvas with precision.
